title: Bill Ending Religious Exemptions on Vaccines Stalls in Albany
text:
As the rate of new measles cases in New York City has slowed, so too has the momentum behind a legislative bill in Albany that would repeal the religious exemption to New York’s school vaccination requirements.

The bill, which would repeal an exception to school vaccination requirements for parents’ “genuine and sincere religious beliefs,” has stalled in the health committee of the state Assembly with just two weeks left before the legislature breaks for the summer.

...
